snippet: Intraparty disputes are not new in Texas, but rarely have the divisions become as heated as they have between supporters of Republican Senate candidates David Dewhurst and Ted Cruz.
abstract: Texas Republicans are sharply divided by the race between Lt Gov David Dewhurst and former Texas solicitor general Ted Cruz to determine the party's nominee for the state's open US Senate seat; Cruz and his Tea Party supporters have accused the state's Republican establishment of compromising too much with Democrats and shying away from a bold conservative approach.
lead_paragraph: Intraparty disputes are not new in Texas, but rarely have the divisions become as heated as they have between supporters of Republican Senate candidates David Dewhurst and Ted Cruz.

headline.seo: Texas Runoff Between Cruz and Dewhurst Fiercely Contested
headline.main: Texas Race for Senate Reveals Rift on the Right
headline.print_headline: Texas Race For Senate Reveals Rift On the Right
